brewery.brewery_description:
Batemans Brewery is a family brewery in Wainfleet Lincs UK, with the fourth generation Jaclyn and Stuart now at the helm, and the fifth training to eventually join the business.  The Brewery was established in 1874.

The beer is brewed by instinct, not by numbers using craft know-how and the best ingredients. Beer that pushes the boundaries. Beer with real flavour and character. Beer that brings people together.

The celebrated Triple XB (XXXB) – a smooth yet distinctively flavoured English tawny beer – was first unveiled in 1978 by the then head brewer, Ken Dixon. It fast became a best-seller and big favourite amongst beer drinkers. In 1986, it was voted CAMRA’s Beer of the Year at the GBBF; and has been named CAMRA Premium Beer of the Year four times since. Along side XXXB 3 other core beers are brewed XB, Yella Belly Gold and Salem Porter.

As well as cask range there are a variety of bottles which can be found in supermarkets, especially locally and on the Brewery’s online shop.

The seasonal beer range celebrates monthly specials traditions, originally brewed for the seasons and inspired by great icons of British heritage. The most famous seasonal beer is Christmas Rosey Nosey.  

Batemans also have an adventurous streak which focuses on small batch production and a bit different from their norm.  This beer evolution is driven through Salem Brew Co. With a new brewer having recently joined there are bound to be some more exciting

beer.beer_description:
Available Mid Nov/Dec
Just like Santa, our Rosey Nosey cuts a colourful figure on a cold December night. Batemans Christmas favourite greets you at the bar with his famous bearded pump-clip and flashing nose, and delivers a wonderfully full-bodied (again, like the man himself), dark amber beer with hints of sultanas, raisins and festive spice

items.badge_description: It's cold outside - warm up with Winter beers. That's at least 25 different Winter beers try 5 more for Level 6!

beer.beer_description: A malty multiple-winner of CAMRA’s Champion Premium Beer of Britain, Batemans much loved XXXB is what you’d call an English tawny beer. Just like the first batch crafted in 1978, it’s brewed with four malts and three varieties of hops, for a deliciously spicy, fruity and biscuity flavour.

items.badge_description: Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 95 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 20!

beer.beer_description:
Available in October draught
Bottle available all year round
Victory Ale is brewed with pale and crystal malts and hopped with English Goldings and American Liberty varieties. A distinctive peppery hop and bitter orange aroma is followed by big hops and fruit flavours with a lingering hop bitterness. Set sail and enjoy.

items.badge_description: Does the word picking favorites mean anything to you? Obviously not. That's 10 different beers in a row.

Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 5 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 2!

Just like the first batch crafted in 1978, it’s brewed with four malts and three varieties of hops, for a deliciously spicy, fruity and biscuity flavour.

Available Mid Nov/Dec
Just like Santa, our Rosey Nosey cuts a colourful figure on a cold December night. Batemans Christmas favourite greets you at the bar with his famous bearded pump-clip and flashing nose, and delivers a wonderfully full-bodied (again, like the man himself), dark amber beer with hints of sultanas, raisins and festive spice

Available in October draught
Bottle available all year round
Victory Ale is brewed with pale and crystal malts and hopped with English Goldings and American Liberty varieties. A distinctive peppery hop and bitter orange aroma is followed by big hops and fruit flavours with a lingering hop bitterness. Set sail and enjoy.

Winner of the Sainsbury’s Great British Beer Hunt, 
Mocha is brewed with genuine Arabica coffee, fine Belgian chocolate and locally-grown roasted barley malt. It is rich, dark, enticing and well rounded.
A unique multigrain beer, which is a combination of malted barley, oats, wheat and rye, creating a dark golden coloured refreshing beer with a dry/sweet character and hints of citrus.

Classic amber pale ale with Lincolnshire pale and chocolate malts, and a blend of English hops (traditional Goldings and the more floral Challenger), then slowly mature it for a grainy, quaffable beer. Not your average English bitter.

Also known as Gold
A golden beer brewed with American Cascade and Chinook hops for a refreshing citrussy flavour and crisp, dry finish.

Available: February to Mid March.
A light amber pale ale drunk in celebration of English rugby. Hooker is brewed with crystal malts and citrusy hops for a fresh, hoppy flavour and a crisp finish. One sip and you’ll be converted.
A vibrant session IPA crafted from an all-English blend of Harlequin, Fuggles and Olicana hops.

Available July/August
A light, golden beer brewed with pale malts and late hopped with Chinook and Bramling Cross to give resinous hints and flavours of lemon.

Available Mid February
Dark in colour yet light in flavour and deceptively drinkable. Hints of cinder toffee and dark fruits, with a refreshing balance. The perfect dark delight

Available June 
Light Amber in colour, with the soft bitterness of classic Fuggles hops to complement the biscuity malt flavours, finished with Bobek and Challenger hops for a spritzy, refreshing drinkability.

Skull & Hammers is small-batch brewed, meaning there’s a limited amount available at any given time.
With no fewer than five hop varieties in the brew, this is a belter of a blended, slow matured, pale ale – yet it’s perfectly balanced. The bitter-sweet, citrus fruit flavour gives way to a smooth aftertaste, making this is a really moreish beer.

Available April
Glorious light amber beer brewed with English Maris Otter malt, the soft bitterness of English Fuggles hops giving a clean, zesty aroma. The perfect way to celebrate St George’s Day!

A collaboration brew with our friends at Blue Monkey Brewery. A curiously delicious balance of spicy, peppery notes from the yeast, an intense aroma with citrus and woody top notes, and hints of tropical fruits and sherbet from the Columbus hops

Available February & March
Pale golden IPA featuring 100% New Zealand hops. The fruity peppery bitterness of Pacific Jade and the pineapple, peach, lime and grapefruit of Kohatu and Nectaron creating this deceptively drinkable IPA.

Available June
A well rounded amber Pale Ale brewed in celebration of English football. The blackcurrant and citrus skills of Jester and Bramling Cross hops up front, with a balanced malty defence of Maris Otter behind.

Available: November
Conceived on Lincolnshire Day, deeply Golden coloured with an aroma of floral tropical fruits; the soft bitterness of Fuggles hops balancing the blend of Maris Otter, Wheat and Crystal Oat malts and the delightful hints of passionfruit, pineapple and mango round off this inspirational ale.

Available in March
A collaboration with Buxton Brewery, this is a Pale Ale with Heritage Chevallier malt and a blend of UK hops. Robust maltiness, marmalade sweetness. Admiral and Emperor hops build the marmalade flavour and aroma; late hopped Cascade add layers of floral, citrus, grapefruit and lychee.

Black in colour and creamy in mouthfeel, Dark Fruits is a delicious porter with a backbone of crystal, chocolate and roasted malts. It is packed full of delectable dark fruits for a slightly sweeter finish in this rich, nutty Spiced beer.

An award-winner since 1992, Salem Porter is dark, rich and chock full of flavour. First you get a lovely little explosion of warm buttered toast and crunchy nut biscuits from the roasted grains. Then the dark fruit hits you, along with strong hints of hazelnuts, almonds, liquorice and spicy hops.

Available May - CeLebrating 150th anniversary
Historical English Pale Ale, based on a recipe from the Batemans archive. Definitively malt forward and perfectly balanced, brewed using Chevallier malt and the classic blend of authentic English Fuggles and Goldings hops.
Pale gold IPA featuring Slovenian hops, a blend of subtle spice, bold citrus and sweet stone-fruit from Bobek, Eagle and Wolf hops grown in the famed Styrian region of Slovenia.
